44ba1374b4b5db7fa7aa33c97","license":"LGPL-3.0-only","urls":["bzz-raw://442e8f808cac95cf9a49cf0de0da39ae2b9317a1b7a3b0b02e6e8473c6b695d2","dweb:/ipfs/QmQuvG7MHj5Vkv6kBNvMUdf4erkRDzVp4q21F5A3DtoSdz"]}},"version":1}

addRecurringPayment(uint256,uint256,addr.details: a new id is created for each Payment

params.amount: : amount of tokens send to the recipient address
params.recipient: : recipient address that should receive tokens
params.startEpoch: : epoch in which the payment starts. Use getEpochFromTimestamp() or getCurrentEpoch() to get the appropriate epoch

returns.id: : id of the newly created recurring payment

amountPaid(uint256).details: Payment Client will reduce the total amount of tokens it will stock up by the given amount This has to be called by a paymentProcessor

params.amount: amount of tokens that have been paid out

collectPaymentOrders().details: Marks the orders as completed for the client.      The responsibility to fulfill the orders are now in the caller's      hand!

returns._1: total amount of token to pay

getCurrentEpoch().details: Calculation is: block.timestamp divided by epochLength

returns.epoch: : epoch in which current timestamp (block.timestamp) belongs to

getEpochFromTimestamp(uint256).details: Calculation is: timestamp divided by epochLength

params.timestamp: : a timestamp in a uint format

returns.epoch: : epoch in which timestamp belongs to

returns._0: Length of an epoch in a uint timestamp

getFutureEpoch(uint256).details: Calculation is: current epoch + X epochs in the future = futureEpoch

params.xEpochsInTheFuture: : how many epochs from the current epoch

params.id: The id of the RecurringPayment to return.
The id of the RecurringPayment to return.

identifier().details: The identifier is defined as the keccak256 hash of the module's      abi packed encoded major version, url and title.

init(address,(uint256,uint256,string,str.details: CAN be overriden by downstream contract.MUST call `__Module_init()`.

params.configData: Variable config data for specific module                   implementations.

returns._0: True if RecurringPayment with id `id` exists, false otherwise.

isTrustedForwarder(address).details: We imitate here the EIP2771 Standard to enable metatransactions As it currently stands we dont want to feed the forwarder address to each module individually and we decided to move this to the orchestrator

params.forwarder: The contract address to be verified.

returns._0: bool Is the given address the trusted forwarder

params.id: : id of the recurring payment that is to be removed
params.prevId: : id of the previous recurring payment in the payment list

triggerFor(uint256,uint256).details: this is to being able to bypass the unlikely event of having a runOutOfGas error for the normal trigger function

params.endId: : id of end position of the recurring payments that should be triggered
params.startId: : id of start position of the recurring payments that should be triggered

addRecurringPayment(uint256,uint256,addr.notice: Adds a recurring payment to the manager

amountPaid(uint256).notice: Notifies the PaymentClient, that tokens have been paid out accordingly

getEpochFromTimestamp(uint256).notice: Calculates the epoch from a given uint timestamp

getEpochLength().notice: Returns the length of an epoch

getFutureEpoch(uint256).notice: Calculates a future epoch x epochs from now

getPreviousPaymentId(uint256).notice: Returns the id of previous RecurringPayment.

getRecurringPaymentInformation(uint256).notice: Returns the RecurringPayment instance with id `id`.

isExistingRecurringPaymentId(uint256).notice: Returns whether RecurringPayment with id `id` exists.

isTrustedForwarder(address).notice: Checks if the provided address is the trusted forwarder

listRecurringPaymentIds().notice: Returns total list of RecurringPayment ids.

outstandingTokenAmount().notice: Returns the total outstanding token payment amount.

paymentOrders().notice: Returns the list of outstanding payment orders.

trigger().notice: Triggers the start of the due payments for all recurring payment orders

triggerFor(uint256,uint256).notice: See trigger() but enables you to determine which ids you want to trigger payment ordes for
